parameterdescription.para: A pointer to the pointer that indicates where to put the next scan result
User provided data
Status of scan process

Pointer to resource interface to provide resources to the driver initialization process
Pointer to a buffer interface to provide buffer related services to the driver instance
Pointer to a whd_netif_funcs_t to provide network stack services to the driver instance

briefdescription.para: Turn on the Wi-Fi device.

detaileddescription.para: Initialise Wi-Fi platform Program various WiFi parameters and modes

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of the driver
Pointer to Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if initialization is successful, error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Turn off the Wi-Fi device.

listitem.para: De-Initialises the required parts of the hardware platform i.e. pins for SDIO/SPI, interrupt, reset, power etc.
De-Initialises the whd thread which arbitrates access to the SDIO/SPI bus

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if deinitialization is successful, Error code otherwise

briefdescription.para: Shutdown this instance of the wifi driver, freeing all used resources.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

briefdescription.para: Brings up the Wi-Fi core.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

briefdescription.para: Bring down the Wi-Fi core.

detaileddescription.para: WARNING / NOTE: This brings down the Wi-Fi core and existing network connections will be lost.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

briefdescription.para: Creates a secondary interface.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of the driver
MAC address for the interface
Pointer to the whd interface pointer

briefdescription.para: Initiates a scan to search for 802.11 networks.

detaileddescription.para: This functions returns the scan results with limited sets of parameter in a buffer provided by the caller. It is also a blocking call. It is an simplified version of the whd_wifi_scan().

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
pointer to user requested records buffer.
No of records user is interested in. If 0 return the total record count.

simplesect.para: When scanning specific channels, devices with a strong signal strength on nearby channels may be detected

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, whd_scan_type_t scan_type, whd_bss_type_t bss_type, const whd_ssid_t *optional_ssid, const whd_mac_t *optional_mac, const uint16_t *optional_channel_list, const whd_scan_extended_params_t *optional_extended_params, whd_scan_result_callback_t callback, whd_scan_result_t *result_ptr, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_scan

briefdescription.para: Initiates a scan to search for 802.11 networks.

detaileddescription.para: The scan progressively accumulates results over time, and may take between 1 and 10 seconds to complete. The results of the scan will be individually provided to the callback function. Note: The callback function will be executed in the context of the WHD thread and so must not perform any actions that may cause a bus transaction.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Specifies whether the scan should be Active, Passive or scan Prohibited channels
Specifies whether the scan should search for Infrastructure networks (those using an Access Point), Ad-hoc networks, or both types.
If this is non-Null, then the scan will only search for networks using the specified SSID.
If this is non-Null, then the scan will only search for networks where the BSSID (MAC address of the Access Point) matches the specified MAC address.
If this is non-Null, then the scan will only search for networks on the specified channels - array of channel numbers to search, terminated with a zero
If this is non-Null, then the scan will obey the specifications about dwell times and number of probes.
The callback function which will receive and process the result data.
Pointer to a pointer to a result storage structure.
user specific data that will be passed directly to the callback function

simplesect.para:
- When scanning specific channels, devices with a strong signal strength on nearby channels may be detected
Callback must not use blocking functions, nor use WHD functions, since it is called from the context of the WHD thread.
The callback, result_ptr and user_data variables will be referenced after the function returns. Those variables must remain valid until the scan is complete.

briefdescription.para: Abort a previously issued scan.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, const whd_ssid_t *ssid, whd_security_t auth_type, const uint8_t *security_key, uint8_t key_length)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_join

briefdescription.para: Joins a Wi-Fi network.

detaileddescription.para: Scans for, associates and authenticates with a Wi-Fi network. On successful return, the system is ready to send data packets.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
A null terminated string containing the SSID name of the network to join
Authentication type
A byte array containing either the cleartext security key for WPA/WPA2/WPA3 secured networks
The length of the security_key in bytes.

simplesect.para: In case of WPA3/WPA2 transition mode, the security_key value is WPA3 password.
WHD_SUCCESS when the system is joined and ready to send data packets Error code if an error occurred

memberdef.argsstring: (whd_interface_t ifp, const whd_scan_result_t *ap, const uint8_t *security_key, uint8_t key_length)
memberdef.name: whd_wifi_join_specific

briefdescription.para: Joins a specific Wi-Fi network.

detaileddescription.para: Associates and authenticates with a specific Wi-Fi access point. On successful return, the system is ready to send data packets.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
A pointer to a whd_scan_result_t structure containing AP details and set ap.channel to 0 for unspecificed channel
A byte array containing either the cleartext security key for WPA/WPA2 secured networks
The length of the security_key in bytes.

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the system is joined and ready to send data packets Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Set the current channel on the WLAN radio.

simplesect.para: On most WLAN devices this will set the channel for both AP AND STA (since there is only one radio - it cannot be on two channels simulaneously)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The desired channel

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the channel was successfully set Error code if the channel was not successfully set

briefdescription.para: Get the current channel on the WLAN radio.

simplesect.para: On most WLAN devices this will get the channel for both AP AND STA (since there is only one radio - it cannot be on two channels simulaneously)

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Pointer to receive the current channel

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the channel was successfully retrieved Error code if the channel was not successfully retrieved

The security key (passphrase) which is to be set
length of the key

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the key is set Error code if an error occurred

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

length of the key

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS when the key is set Error code if an error occurred

briefdescription.para: Set the beacon interval.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the value needs to be set before ap_start in order to beacon interval to take effect.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Beacon interval in time units (Default: 100 time units = 102.4 ms)

briefdescription.para: Set the DTIM interval.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the value needs to be set before ap_start in order to DTIM interval to take effect.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
DTIM interval, in unit of beacon interval

briefdescription.para: Enables powersave mode on specified interface without regard for throughput reduction.

detaileddescription.para: This function enables (legacy) 802.11 PS-Poll mode and should be used to achieve the lowest power consumption possible when the Wi-Fi device is primarily passively listening to the network

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

briefdescription.para: Enables powersave mode on specified interface while attempting to maximise throughput.

detaileddescription.para: Network traffic is typically bursty. Reception of a packet often means that another packet will be received shortly afterwards (and vice versa for transmit).
In high throughput powersave mode, rather then entering powersave mode immediately after receiving or sending a packet, the WLAN chip waits for a timeout period before returning to sleep.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The variable to set return to sleep delay. return to sleep delay must be set to a multiple of 10 and not equal to zero.

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if power save mode was successfully enabled Error code if power save mode was not successfully enabled

briefdescription.para: Get powersave mode on specified interface.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Value of the current powersave state PM1_POWERSAVE_MODE, PM2_POWERSAVE_MODE, NO_POWERSAVE_MODE

briefdescription.para: Disables 802.11 power save mode on specified interface.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if power save mode was successfully disabled Error code if power save mode was not successfully disabled

briefdescription.para: Registers interest in a multicast address.

detaileddescription.para: Once a multicast address has been registered, all packets detected on the medium destined for that address are forwarded to the host. Otherwise they are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Ethernet MAC address

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the address was registered successfully Error code if the address was not registered

briefdescription.para: Unregisters interest in a multicast address.

detaileddescription.para: Once a multicast address has been unregistered, all packets detected on the medium destined for that address are ignored.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
Ethernet MAC address

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the address was unregistered successfully Error code if the address was not unregistered

briefdescription.para: Sets the 802.11 powersave listen interval for a Wi-Fi client, and communicates the listen interval to the Access Point.

detaileddescription.para: The listen interval will be set to (listen_interval x time_unit) seconds.
The default value for the listen interval is 0. With the default value of 0 set, the Wi-Fi device wakes to listen for AP beacons every DTIM period.
If the DTIM listen interval is non-zero, the DTIM listen interval will over ride the beacon listen interval value.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The desired beacon listen interval
The listen interval time unit; options are beacon period or DTIM period.

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS If the listen interval was successfully set. Error code If the listen interval was not successfully set.

briefdescription.para: Gets the current value of all beacon listen interval variables.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

Powersave listen interval values
listen_interval_beacon : The current value of the listen interval set as a multiple of the beacon period
listen_interval_dtim : The current value of the listen interval set as a multiple of the DTIM period
listen_interval_assoc : The current value of the listen interval sent to access points in an association request frame

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS If all listen interval values are read successfully Error code If at least one of the listen interval values are NOT read successfully

briefdescription.para: Determines if a particular interface is ready to transceive ethernet packets.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the interface is ready to transceive ethernet packets WHD_NOTFOUND no AP with a matching SSID was found WHD_NOT_AUTHENTICATED Matching AP was found but it won't let you authenticate. This can occur if this device is in the block list on the AP. WHD_NOT_KEYED Device has authenticated and associated but has not completed the key exchange. This can occur if the passphrase is incorrect. Error code if the interface is not ready to transceive ethernet packets

briefdescription.para: Retrieve the latest STA EDCF AC parameters.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieve the latest Station (STA) interface EDCF (Enhanced Distributed Coordination Function) Access Category parameters

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to handle instance of whd interface
The location where the array of AC parameters will be stored

simplesect.para: WHD_SUCCESS if the AC Parameters were successfully retrieved Error code if the AC Parameters were not retrieved

briefdescription.para: Prototypes of functions for controlling the Wi-Fi system.

detaileddescription.para: This file provides prototypes for end-user functions which allow actions such as scanning for Wi-Fi networks, joining Wi-Fi networks, getting the MAC address, etc
